etymology.description: semantic: 口 ‘mouth’ + semantic: 八 ‘divide’ → ‘disperse breath’; later borrowed to write ‘four’, replacing 亖.
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicting breath being divided within a mouth, the graph was a semantic compound of 口 and 八. To avoid confusion between 亖 and 二/三 in vertical writing, this graph was borrowed to represent the numeral ‘four’ and standardized in the Qin era.

examples.chinese: 我有四个朋友(我有四個朋友)。
现在四点了(現在四點了)，我们出发吧(我們出發吧)。
examples.pinyin: Xiànzài sì diǎn le, wǒmen chūfā ba.
examples.english: It’s four o’clock now; let’s set off.

examples.chinese: 他住在第四层(他住在第四層)。
examples.english: He lives on the fourth floor.
